sen.j: 大伴 金村（おおとも の かなむら、生没年不詳）は、5世紀から6世紀にかけての豪族（大連 (古代日本)）。
sen.e: OTOMO no Kanamura (date of birth and death unknown) was a Gozoku (local ruling family) who lived from fifth century to sixth century.
OTOMO no Kanamura (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of Gozoku (local ruling family) who lived from the fifth to the sixth centuries.
sen.cmt: ・a Gozoku→a member of Gozoku・from fifth century to sixth century.→from the fifth to the sixth centuries.
sen.e: OTOMO no Kanamura (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of Gozoku (local ruling family) who lived from the fifth to the sixth centuries.

sen.j: 祖父は大伴室屋（おおとものむろや）。
sen.e: His grandfather was OTOMO no Muroya.
His grandfather was OTOMO no Muroya.
His grandfather was OTOMO no Muroya.

sen.j: 父は大伴談（おおとものかたり）。
sen.e: His father was OTOMO no Katari.
His father was OTOMO no Katari.
His father was OTOMO no Katari.
OTOMO no Utafu was his brother.
OTOMO no Utafu was his younger brother.
OTOMO no Utafu was his younger brother.

sen.j: 子に大伴磐（いわ）・大伴狭手彦（さてひこ）・大伴咋（くい）がいる。
sen.e: His three children were OTOMO no Iwa, OTOMO no Satehiko and OTOMO no Kui.
His three children were OTOMO no Iwa, OTOMO no Satehiko and OTOMO no Kui.

sen.j: 498年、仁賢天皇の死後、平群真鳥（へぐりのまとり）・平群鮪（しび）父子を征討し、武烈天皇を即位させて自らは大連（おおむらじ）の地位についた。
sen.e: In 498, after the death of Emperor Ninken, he destroyed HEGURI no Matori and HEGRUI no Shibi father and son, let Emperor Buretsu ascend the throne and took the position of Omuraji (hereditary title.)
In 498, after the death of Emperor Ninken, he defeated HEGURI no Matori and his son, HEGRUI no Shibi, let Emperor Buretsu ascend the throne and took the position of Omuraji (hereditary title).
sen.cmt: ・destroyed→defeated・HEGURI no Matori and HEGRUI no Shibi father and son→HEGURI no Matori and his son, HEGRUI no Shibi
sen.e: In 498, after the death of Emperor Ninken, he defeated HEGURI no Matori and his son, HEGRUI no Shibi, let Emperor Buretsu ascend the throne and took the position of Omuraji (hereditary title).

sen.j: 506年の武烈天皇の死により皇統は途絶えたが、応神天皇の玄孫である彦主人王の子を越前から迎え継体天皇とし、以後安閑天皇・宣化天皇・欽明天皇の各天皇に仕えた。
sen.e: Due to the death of Emperor Buretsu, imperial line failed but he invited a child of Hikoushio from Echizen who was a great-great-grandson of Emperor to let him ascend the throne as Emperor Keitai and Kanamura served Emperor Ankan, Emperor Senken, and Emperor Kinmei since then.

Due to the death of Emperor Buretsu in 506, the imperial line failed, therefore Kanamura invited a child in Echizen Province of Hikoushi Ou who was a great-great-grandson of Emperor Ojin to let him ascend the throne as Emperor Keitai and Kanamura served Emperor Ankan, Emperor Senka, and Emperor Kinmei since then.
sen.cmt: ・Due to the death of Emperor Buretsu→Due to the death of Emperor Buretsu in 506・imperial line→the imperial line・but→therefore・he→Kanamura・a child of Hikoushio from Echizen who was a great-great-grandson of Emperor→a child in Echizen Province of Hikoushi Ou who was a great-great-grandson of Emperor Ojin・Emperor Senken→Emperor Senka
sen.e: Due to the death of Emperor Buretsu in 506, the imperial line failed, therefore Kanamura invited a child in Echizen Province of Hikoushi Ou who was a great-great-grandson of Emperor Ojin to let him ascend the throne as Emperor Keitai and Kanamura served Emperor Ankan, Emperor Senka, and Emperor Kinmei since then.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によると512年に百済からの任那4県割譲要求があり、金村はこれを承認し、代わりに五経博士を渡来させた。
sen.e: According to the "Nihon Shoki," Kanamura approved the demand of ceding Minama four prefectures from Baekje and let Gokyo Hakase visit instead.
According to the "Nihon Shoki," Kanamura approved the demand of ceding Minama four prefectures from Baekje in 512 and let Gokyo Hakase visit instead.

sen.j: 527年の磐井の乱の際には物部麁鹿火を将軍に任命して鎮圧させた。
sen.e: In 527, when Iwai War occurred, he assigned MONONOBE no Arakaike as Shogun to put down the enemies.
In 527, when the Iwai War occurred, he assigned MONONOBE no Arakahi as Shogun to put down the enemies.
sen.cmt: ・Iwai War→the Iwai War・MONONOBE no Arakaike→MONONOBE no Arakahi
sen.e: In 527, when the Iwai War occurred, he assigned MONONOBE no Arakahi as Shogun to put down the enemies.

sen.j: だが、欽明天皇の代に入ると欽明天皇と血縁関係を結んだ蘇我稲目が台頭して、金村の権勢に翳りが見え始める。
sen.e: However, when entered the Emperor Kinmei period, SOGA no Iname who had a blood relationship with Emperor Kinmei gained power so kanamura's ascendancy began to decline.

sen.cmt: when entered the Emperor Kinmei period→in the Emperor Kinmei period
sen.e: However, in the Emperor Kinmei period, SOGA no Iname who had a blood relationship with Emperor Kinmei gained power so kanamura's ascendancy began to decline.

sen.j: そして、540年には新羅が任那地方を併合するという事件があり、物部尾輿などから外交政策の失敗（先の任那4県割譲など）を糾弾され失脚して隠居する。
sen.e: He was accused of the foreign policy failure (the ceding of Mimana and so on) by MONONOBE no Okoshi and fell from the position and retired.
Because of the occupation of Mimana by Silla in 540, he was accused of the foreign policy failure (the ceding of Mimana and so on) by MONONOBE no Okoshi and fell from his position and retired.
sen.cmt: ・『Because of the occupation of Mimana by Silla in 540』を追記しました。・the position→his position
sen.e: Because of the occupation of Mimana by Silla in 540, he was accused of the foreign policy failure (the ceding of Mimana and so on) by MONONOBE no Okoshi and fell from his position and retired.

sen.j: これ以後、大伴氏は衰退していった。
sen.e: After this, Otomo clan gradually declined.
Since then, the Otomo clan gradually declined.
sen.cmt: ・After this,→Since then,・Otomo clan→the Otomo clan
sen.e: Since then, the Otomo clan gradually declined.

sen.j: 晩年は大伴氏の館のあった摂津国住吉郡（大阪市住吉区）に住み、そこで死去。
sen.e: In his later years, he lived Sumiyoshi-gun, Settsu Province (Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City) where there was Otomo's mansion and died there.

sen.j: 住吉区にある帝塚山古墳は、大伴金村あるいはその子の墓とされている。
sen.e: It is believed that Tezukayama-kofun Tumulus in Sumiyosi Ward is a tomb of OTOMO no kanamura or his child's.
